Course Name: Sociology of India: Themes and Perspectives
Course Description: This course will equip students with an understanding of the foundations, contemporary debates and relevant themes of Sociology and Social Anthropology in India. It seeks to familiarise students with the discipline as a pre-requirement to doing research in Sociology/Social Anthropology. With this main objective in mind, the course is broadly divided in two parts: the first part engages with the debatessurrounding, theory, approaches, methods, contextualisation, refexivity and so on in Sociology. The second part, introduces key themes in Sociology and Social Anthropology. By the end of the course, the students will be able to develop agrounding in Sociology and use it to envision their own research.

Course Outcomes.CO1: To identify various Sociological Concepts, Themes and Traditions
Course Outcomes.CO2: To contextually situate sociological knowledge and research
Course Outcomes.CO3: To develop a relevance of reflexivity and contextualisation
Course Outcomes.CO4: To apply a critical analytical lens to studying various themes in Sociology
Course Outcomes.CO5: To construct an independent critical-reflexive approach towrads research problems

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Many Sociologies: Sociology in India and the World
Themes in Sociology: Gender and Sexuality
Themes in Sociology: Social Relations and Social Structure
Themes in Sociology: Social Stratification and Inequality
